newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Rising Swiss franc dominate Hungary futures market.
newsitem.headline: Rising Swiss franc dominate Hungary futures market.

text.p: Rising Swiss franc futures were in focus on the Budapest Commodity Exchange (BCE) on Monday, while no deals were struck on the Budapest Stock Exchange (BSE), traders said.
The BCE's financial section posted turnover of 6.3 billion forints, slightly lower than Friday's 6.54 billion but still above average, traders added.
Swiss franc futures rose by 13 fillers for September and 35 fillers for December but traders said the market expected a downward movement to start.
"Most players are banking on a later price drop," said BCE trader Janos Mladenszki of Futures Broker.
He added that a considerable part of Monday's Swiss franc turnover was generated by banks' purchases, mainly for December.
A total 16,940 Swiss franc futures changed hands on Monday accounting for almost half of the BCE's currency futures turnover.
Last week's favourite of the BCE, the yen, continued to account for a significant number of contracts as it dropped 1.15 forints for June to end at 149.60.
Sterling futures for April registered the sharpest fall of 3.2 forints.
All dollar futures ended lower by 0.7 to 1.05 forints and gave 6,263 contracts of the total 36,179 contracts turnover.
On the BSE, only dollar futures prices changed, closing lower by between 0.42 and 1.33 forints for all but the March maturity which remained steady at 176.98 forints.
December contracts fell the most, ending at 195.48, down 1.33.
